summary: "The Beatles," often called the White Album, is the band's ninth studio album, released in 1968. It has a simple white cover, contrasting with their previous colorful art. The album contains 30 songs in various genres like folk, country rock, and avant-garde. It was their first release on Apple Records. Recording was challenging due to creative differences and personal tensions, leading to Ringo Starr's temporary departure. The album received positive reviews and was a commercial success, topping charts in Britain and the U.S. It's now considered one of the greatest albums ever.
title: The Beatles (album)
